column4: Anyone help me with my external hard drive? It's plugged in and hasn't automounted, and the process of manually mounting it has confused me
An icon should normally appear on your desktop. Check to see if you can find the name of your USB hard disk in Nautilus.
Please nopaste the output of '~$ df -h' when your USB hard disk is inserted.
Your USB hard disk is not mounted.
Yes, I was hoping to get help with that
Please nopaste the output of '~$ lsusb'.
Please do the same after having unplugged your USB hard drive.
So your kernel's USB subsystem recognizes your hard drive as "Seagate RSS LLC".  -- Now you need to mount this hard drive.
Ok, so I'm guessing I'm gonna want to replug it...then what?
Yes. Please re-plug it. Then look in Nautilus if you can find a device /dev/sdb or similar.
There is no "sdb", but there is "shm" and "snd"
snd stands for "sound" and is not what we want. --  Let me see what shm stands for.
shm probably stands for "shared memory" and is nto what we want either.
